title: PPG Reports Slightly Higher Sales in Latest Quarter
text:
By Patrick Thomas

PPG Industries Inc. said its sales inched higher in its latest quarter as higher prices helped offset lower sales volume.

The Pittsburgh-based paint maker said it bumped selling prices up by 2.6% during the period, which helped offset a nearly 3% decline in volume. Overall, sales grew to $3.83 billion from $3.82 billion a year earlier, below the $3.89 billion analysts polled by FactSet had expected for the quarter.

PPG reported a profit of $367 million, or $1.54 a share, compared with $378 million, or $1.55 a share, a year ago. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of $1.61 a share. Excluding one-time costs, the company posted an adjusted profit of $1.67 a share.

"As we look ahead to the fourth quarter, we anticipate global economic growth will remain soft impacting several end-use markets," company Chief Executive Michael McGarry said. "Many of our customers remain cautious about their ordering patterns and inventory levels," he said.

Last month, the company reached a settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to close an investigation into accounting irregularities at the company without paying a fine.

The paint maker fired its controller last year after it uncovered what it said were multiple instances of improperly adjusted financial metrics.
